S-task1.hypothesis: Distractor Effect Hypothesis, Attribute Sorting Hypothesis
S-task1.prompt: Find the North American with the most Tweets

S-task1A.hypothesis: Distractor Effect Hypothesis, Attribute Sorting Hypothesis
S-task1A.prompt: Find the European with the least likes

S-task3.prompt: Which person has many interactions (edges) in this network, several followers, but few tweets and likes in general?

S-task4.prompt: Find all of Lane's European Neighbors

S-task4A.prompt: Find all of giCentre's North American Neighbors

S-task5.prompt: Who had the most mention interactions with Jeffrey?

S-task6.prompt: Does Alex have more mention interactions with North American or European accounts?

S-task7.hypothesis: Topology plus Simple Attributes Hypothesis, Common Neighbor Hypothesis
S-task7.prompt: Among all people who have interacted with both Jeffrey and Robert, who has the most followers?

S-task8.prompt: What is the most common form of interaction between Evis19 and Jon? How often has this interaction happened?

S-task9.hypothesis: Within Node Comparison Hypothesis, Small/Large Effect
S-task9.prompt: Select all of Noeska’s neighbors that are people and have more friends than followers

S-task9A.prompt: Select the people who have interacted with Thomas and have more friends than followers

S-task11.prompt: Select all the people who are in a cluster with Alex. Estimate the average number of likes among the selected people.

S-task12.prompt: Select all the Europeans on the shortest path [3 nodes / 2 edges] from Alex to Mandy [including Alex and Mandy].

S-task12A.prompt: Select all the North Americans on the shortest path [3 nodes / 2 edges] from Roeland to Micah [including Roeland and Micah].

S-task13.prompt: Of the North Americans who are within two interactions of Sereno, who has been on twitter the longest?

S-taskExplore.prompt: Please explore the network freely and report on your findings. Is there anything surprising or particularly interesting in the network?
